sample_queries.question: Show all information in the patients data?
sample_queries.query: select patient_id, first_name, last_name, date_of_birth, gender, phone_number, email, address from public.patients;

sample_queries.question: Show all information in the medical record data?
sample_queries.query: select record_id, patient_id, visit_date, diagnosis, treatment, doctor_name, notes from medical_records;

sample_queries.question: Show all information in the penguin data?
sample_queries.query: select species, island, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g, sex, year from penguins;

sample_queries.question: Show all information in the titanic data.
sample_queries.query: select passenger_id, survived, pclass, name, sex, age, sib_sp, parch, ticket, fare, cabin, embarked from titanic_train;

sample_queries.question: How many records are there for people that survived?
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) as Number_of_Records FROM titanic_train WHERE survived = 1;

sample_queries.question: How many records are there shown by if they survived?
sample_queries.query: SELECT survived, COUNT(*) AS Number_of_Records FROM titanic_train GROUP BY survived;

sample_queries.question: How many passengers survived and did not survive?
sample_queries.query: SELECT survived, COUNT(distinct passenger_id) AS Number_of_Passengers FROM titanic_train GROUP BY survived;

sample_queries.question: How many passengers survived?
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(distinct passenger_id) AS Number_of_Passengers FROM titanic_train WHERE survived = 1;

sample_queries.question: How many passengers did not survive?
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(distinct passenger_id) AS Number_of_Passengers FROM titanic_train WHERE survived = 0;

sample_queries.question: how many patients see each doctor
how many patients see each doctor
how many patients were there
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(patient_id) AS total_patients FROM patients;

sample_queries.question: how many patients were sick
how many doctors are there
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT doctor_name) AS number_of_doctors FROM medical_records;

sample_queries.question: What are all of the patients?
sample_queries.query: SELECT * FROM patients;

sample_queries.question: which patients have which diagnosis
Can you show me all the patients who have had an Annual Check-up?
sample_queries.query:
SELECT p.patient_id, p.first_name, p.last_name
FROM patients p
JOIN medical_records mr ON p.patient_id = mr.patient_id
WHERE mr.diagnosis = 'Annual Check-up';

sample_queries.question: how many patients are there
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(patient_id) AS total_patients FROM patients;

sample_queries.question: based on sex what were the survival rates
sample_queries.query:
SELECT sex, survived, COUNT(*) AS count
FROM titanic_train
GROUP BY sex, survived
ORDER BY sex, survived;

sample_queries.question: based on the fare price what were the survival rates
how many people on the titanic were male
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) AS number_of_male_passengers FROM titanic_train WHERE sex = 'male';

sample_queries.question: how many people survived the titanic
sample_queries.query: SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_survived FROM titanic_train WHERE survived = 1;

sample_documents.documentation: The columns asthma, diabetes, hypertension, obesity, prediabetes, tobacco, breast_cancer_screening, cervical_cancer_screening, colorectal_cancer_screening in the wny_health table can only have values 'Y' or 'N'. 'Y' indicates YES or TRUE, while 'N' indicates NO or FALSE.
